name: Malt Vinegar
properties: Darker color and maltier flavor than other vinegars
Helps spices adhere to vegetables before roasting
Adds tangy, complex flavor to roasted vegetables
Can be substituted with apple cider vinegar
benefits: Malt vinegar adds complex, malty tang to roasted vegetables and can help spices stick to foods. Like other vinegars, it may help with blood sugar control when consumed with meals. The acidity enhances flavor while adding minimal calories.
amount: 1/3 cup (50ml) for coating vegetables (4 servings), or as needed for spritzing

quotes: 1/3 cup/50ml malt vinegar or apple cider vinegar, plus more to serve - Sage-Kissed Sweet Potato Wedges with Shallots (page 208)
Pour the vinegar onto the sweet potatoes and toss to coat (page 208)
Serve immediately, with a little more vinegar if desired (page 208)
Hint: Keep a spray bottle handy with your favourite vinegar. Spritz vegetables before roasting to help spices adhere and to add a last-minute burst of flavour to salads and other dishes (page 230)
